snippet: In public housing projects, the apartment door has become a target with which, via a strategically aimed bullet, a dispute is made public, an enemy is warned or a rival is brought to the attention of the police.
abstract: Apartment doors in public housing projects have become a target with which, via a strategically aimed bullet, dispute is made public, enemy is warned, or rival is brought to the attention of the police; police nor New York City Housing Authority track hallway shootings in which people are not the target; only pocked doors and neighbors' recollections reveal how many times those episodes involved a doorway being blasted.

byline.contributor: Joe Goldstein and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: In public housing projects, the apartment door has become a target with which, via a strategically aimed bullet, a dispute is made public, an enemy is warned or a rival is brought to the attention of the police.

headline.seo: Steely Sentinels When Bullets Come Knocking
headline.main: Steely Sentinels When Bullets Come Knocking
